history.content: I didn't take it with Hellerstein, but workload is comparable to 61b. The material is more in-depth obviously since the class is purely on databases, but I found the exams to be much more straightforward than the exams for 61a and 61b. If you keep up with the lectures and readings you shouldn't have too much of an issue with the class. As for the waitlist, apply the 10% rule to roughly figure out your chances of getting in.

I didn't take it with Hellerstein, but workload is comparable to 61b. The material is more in-depth obviously since the class is purely on databases, but I found the exams to be much more straightforward than the exams for 61a and 61b. If you keep up with the lectures and readings you shouldn't have too much of an issue with the class.

Currently a rising sophomore with 61AB, Data 8, Stat 134 under my belt (did well in them). Compared to 61AB, how is the workload/difficulty (in terms of concepts/exams) of CS 186 with Hellerstein?

Also, if I were to put myself on the waitlist a couple days from now, what are the chances I'll get into the class? I am not declared yet (but I don't think that matters any more).

Thanks!
